Christopher T. Guy

“Change is Inevitable,

Growth is Optional.”

John C. Maxwell

Certified "Red Seal" Electrician Since 1996.

I started my Electrical apprenticeship in March 1990.

I worked mostly as a commercial electrician for the first 8 years in the trade. I moved on to the Oil Sands in the late 1990's. From 2000 to 2017 I worked mostly as an Industrial Electrician. I learned quite a few other skills in the time as well. I worked in the QA/QC departments for a few different Oil Sands Projects, where I learned a bit about databases and how useful they are (MS Access). I held Sub-foreman/Foreman/GeneralForeman positions later on in my career, this gave me management skills like Planning, Safety and Accountability. I always loved building things, so I ended up learning other trades along the way in my 30 years in construction, Plumbing basics, Carpentry basics, Drywalling & Taping, Painting and most general Handyman skills.
